definitions.definition: make (something) visible, typically by uncovering it.
examples: at low tide the sands are exposed

definitions.definition: leave (something) uncovered or unprotected, especially from the weather.
subject (photographic film) to light, especially when operating a camera.
publicly and indecently display one's genitals.
leave or put (someone) in an unprotected and vulnerable state.
synonyms: put in jeopardy of/from "he was exposed to asbestos"

definitions.definition: cause someone to experience or be at risk of.
examples: he exposed himself unnecessarily to gunfire in the war
investigations exposed a vast network of illegalities

definitions.definition: reveal the true and typically objectionable nature of (someone or something).
examples: he has been exposed as a liar and a traitor
synonyms: blow the whistle on "he was exposed as a liar"

definitions.definition: introduce someone to (a subject or area of knowledge).
examples: students were exposed to probability and statistics in high school
synonyms: acquaint with "they were exposed to liberal ideas"

definitions.definition: leave (a child) in the open to die.
